column1: Lung metastases are cancerous tumors that start somewhere else in the body and spread to the lungs.
Metastatic tumors in the lungs are cancers that developed at other places in the body (or other parts of the lungs) and spread through the bloodstream or lymphatic system to the lungs.
It is different than lung cancer that starts in the lungs.

Symptoms may include any of the following: - Bloody sputum - Chest pain - Cough - Shortness of breath - Weakness - Weight loss In most cases, there are no lung-related symptoms when the tumors are found.
